column1: Dialogue ID ‘intro’ is their introduction line
Dialogue ID of ‘default’ means unlocked from the beginning
Dialogue ID of ‘’ is their response to an invalid dialogue input
Q? means if it’s a question or not
Dialogue can’t use double quotation marks!

column4: Text
<>Gonna have to speak up, darling. It’s quite loud in here.<>
<>Nice to meet you! Sit anywhere you like. It’s pretty slow right now.
<>We have wheat ale for two copper. Interested?
<RUMOR>Heard any rumors lately?
<>Hmm...let’s see. A merchant was robbed a couple of days ago just outside of town. They say it was bandits.
<>I don’t understand you.
<>I have traveled for a long while. It’s high time I enjoy some entertainment.
<>Need something? Everything’s for sale, for the right <ITEM_GOLD>coin.
<MONSTER>You were robbed?
<>Robbed? No, we were attacked! By tiny green creatures, no less. They killed half my guards before taking off with my stock.
You can’t just have my gold! I can offer you a loan, however.
<>Huh?
<>I parked my giant panther out front.
<>The woods are quiet tonight.
<KOBOLDS>What do you know about tiny green creatures?
<>You mean kobolds? Pests! You never see them coming. They love to lay traps. And they love gold even more.
<>Come again?
<>The pleasure is mine.
<>Who do you want killed?
<TRAPS>What can you tell me about kobold traps?
<>Pretty basic stuff. Any <ITEM_THIEFSKIT>thief’s kit<>would make short work of ‘em.
<>I got an extra one, if you need it. Just let me know.
<>What?
<>Fine night for a drink.
<>What d’ya want? I’m off duty.
<TOWN_KOBOLDS>Are kobolds a threat to the town?
<>Kobolds?! Here? The town must be defended at all costs!
<TOWN_QUIET>What’s happening in town?
Nothing! The whole town was quiet today. I hated it!
